moves.1. Nf3: This game (unrated) was decided as a training game and was supposed to be anotated for learning purpose. Thank you for the comments.
moves.1... d6 2. d4 Nf6 3. c4: The game has turned into a queen gambit
moves.5... O-O 6. Be2 Bg4 7. Be3 Nbd7 8. O-O B: losing the bishop pair for an unecessary trade
moves.10... a6 11. b4: Slowing black advance on the queenside
moves.12... h5: doubtfull move : it weakens the black king
moves.13. Qd2:
White's developpement is completed (rooks are joined) - bayonnet attack (queen and bishop against fianchetoed bishop)

 Lasker's 7 points analysis :
1. immediate threats : none
2. material : equality
3. Center : white is stronger
4. Open files : none
5. Pawn structures : both are ok
6. Safety of the king : the black king is weakened
7. General organisation : the black rooks are not joined
7
moves.14. Be2: Preparing the attack. White plans to attack the kingside straight away, now that the center is closed
moves.15. f4: Launching a kingside attack. The risk is an attack of the white king by the DSB but white estimates that it's ok
moves.15... f5: increasing the weakness of the king
moves.16. exf5 Rxf5 17. Ne4: The knight has to be part of the attack - black is in trouble
moves.17... Ndf6 18. Ng5+: Strong menace - black will lose material
moves.18... Rxg5: Probably the best move (fork attack between queen and king if 18... Kh8 or discovery chess if 18.... Kh6)
moves.19. fxg5:
7 points analysis :
1. Immediate threats : the black knight on f6 (Black's DSB is menacing the a1 rook but not immediately).
2. Material : advantage white
3. Center : contested.
4. Open file : the f one - under white's control.
5. Pawn structures : The white one isn't very good (unsupported pawn on g5)
6. safety of the kings : the white one is weakened by the attack but the black one is worse
7. general organisation : all the pieces are protected - white has plenty of material aiming at the black king.
moves.19... Ng4: Doubtfull move : the next trade will be disastrous for black, for it'll destroy black's pawn structure and the black king will be terribly weak.
moves.20. Bxg4 hxg4: Now black is in very serious trouble if white manages to send the queen or a rook on h4
moves.21... e4: Black's counterattack will be to slow, moving the queen would have been better.
moves.22. Qh4+: There is probably a mate whithin the next 10 moves, whatever black does now.
